title: Introduction to Linked Lists
subject: Data Structures
theory: A Linked List is a linear data structure where elements are not stored contiguously. Each element (Node) contains **Data** and a **Pointer** to the next node. Dynamic size, easy insertion.
syntax: class Node { int data; Node next; }

common_mistakes.correction: If you lose the pointer to the first node (Head), the entire list is lost (Memory Leak).

interview_questions.question: Array vs Linked List?
interview_questions.answer: Array: Fast access O(1), Slow insert O(n). LL: Slow access O(n), Fast insert O(1) (if pointer known).

summary: Linked Lists trade access speed for insertion flexibility.
